event.name: NEBULA_STARGROVE_STORM_REVISIT
event.text: You've been here already, and there's nothing left of interest.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_SUN_REVISIT
event.text: You've been here already, and there's nothing left of interest. The sun here makes it too dangerous to do something onboard the ship, you'll have to leave as soon as possible.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_BLUEGIANT_REVISIT
event.text: You've been here already, and there's nothing left of interest. The sun here makes it too dangerous to do something onboard the ship, you'll have to leave as soon as possible.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_PULSAR_REVISIT
event.text: You've been here already, and there's nothing left of interest. The pulsar here makes it too dangerous to do something onboard the ship, you'll have to leave as soon as possible.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_ASTEROID_REVISIT
event.text: You've been here already, and there's nothing left of interest. The asteroids here make it too dangerous to do something onboard the ship, you'll have to leave as soon as possible.

event.name: STARGROVE_GRAVASTAR_REVISIT
event.text: You've been here already, and there's nothing left of interest. The Gravastar makes it too dangerous to do something onboard the ship, you'll have to leave as soon as possible.

destroyed.text: You've defeated the highwayman, and are able to recover a large bounty of salvage from the wreck.

deadCrew.text: With his last breath, the highwayman pulls some type of remote-control out of his pocket and presses a button. You hear a small explosion, and though the ship doesn't seem to have sustained any significant damage, you eventually find the smoldering wreckage of the Pre-Igniter. Despite this setback, you're still able to pull a large amount of scrap from the ship, as well as the Pre-emptive Ion weapon.

event.name: FINISH_BEACON_STARGROVE
event.text: You've arrived at the exit...

event.name: NEBULA_FINISH_BEACON_STARGROVE
event.text: You've arrived at the exit...

event.name: STARGROVE_HIGHWAYMAN_INITIAL
event.text: A ship guarding the exit beacon warms up their weapons as you approach and sends a message. A cocky-looking pirate appears onscreen. Swords line the back wall of his communication room as he smirks at you. "Ah, somebody wants to leave, huh? I'm afraid you're not doing so for free." The highwayman gestures behind him. "Y'see my weapons? I've got a Pre-Igniter, and you can say goodbye to your precious shields if you dare defy me... And don't even think about cloaking! You have no chance, so just give me your scrap and move along."

choice.text: I don't even have shields, dumbass.
We don't even have 100~. Could we make some other deal?

event.name: STARGROVE_POST_HIGHWAYMAN
event.text: Looks like the highwayman's ship is gone now, but a Rebel Auto-ship has taken control of the beacon! You'll have to fight your way out!

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Try to escape the Auto.

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_TUCO
event.text:
Tuco laughs. "Well, Zirc, looks like you survived the aftermath of that heist after all. I see you've been promoted."
"Oh, it's you, 'Captain.' Surprised you actually found a crew willing to put up with you."
"Which one of us is currently rotting away in Hell? ...Well, I guess we both are, but the difference is, I'm not trapped here."
The highwayman rolls his eyes. "I take your point."
"Well, what do you say? Why don't you let us through, as a favor to your old captain?"
"Oh sure. But only if you pay me back for all those drinks you kept leaving on my tab. I'll just append it to the discount I would have given you."
The Highwayman looks surprised as you give him what he wants. "Well, Captain, it looks like people do change. Color me impressed. I won't trouble you any further."
"Hah. I knew you would never pay back your debts. I'll take it from your corpse."

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_KAZ
event.text:
Kazaaakplethkilik clicks and tilts his head. "Where is Malaakepikipilthen? He is accompanying your raid, yes?"
"He's dead. Took on too many Rocks at once." The Highwayman shakes his head.
"Kazaaakplethkilik always knew he'd go out that way. A careless pirate is a dead pirate." Kazaaakplethkilik flexes a scythe menacingly. "Don't you go making the same mistake he did."
The Highwayman pauses. "...You know, Kaz, I've always respected you. If you're going to leave without paying, I won't stop you."
"Bloodthirsty as ever, are we? I'll make you regret that."

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_A55
event.text:
"Yo ho ho. 'Twere a beautiful act o' piracy ye committed. My hat is off to ye."
"So you heard. Yes, with such a nice ship, how was I supposed to avoid swiping it?"
"Yar har har. I be getting it perfectly fine. What say ye give us free passage?"
"Gotta make a living, you understand. I'll give you my extra low friends discount. What say you?"
"Much obliged, Captain A55. Have fun committing piracy."

choice.text: We don't even have 20~. Could we make some other deal?

event.text: Zirc stares at A55 and mutters. "Ah, whatever. Sounds like you're not even worth robbing. You can go."
"Then we'll find out who the better pirate is. Fine by me!"

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_NIGHTS
event.text:
Nights starts laughing. "It'ssss what'ssss hissss name! Cowering in the oven, hoping to not be found. Hahahaha!"
"Nights..." The Highwayman glares. "There's no way I'll miss the chance to crush you into a fine paste."

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_FIGHT
event.text: You have no intention of letting some two-bit pirate take your hard-earned salvage. You warm up your weapons system.

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_NOSHIELDS
event.text: The highwayman looks befuddled. "You... you made it all the way through the Stargrove without shields...? What's wrong with you? How did you even...?" The highwayman clears his throat. "You know what? Forget the fee. Just go. I'm actually kinda scared of you."
"What? But I was letting you go! Ah, whatever! You'll regret your arrogance, Renegade!"

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_PAY
event.text: The pirate gleefully collects his toll from you. "Move along, Renegade. We have upgrades to perform."

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_RENEGOTIATION_FAILED
event.text: "So be it! You'll die here and now."

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_THREATEN
event.text:
You inform the pirate that your ship is fortified against ion attacks, which counters their strategy. This will not be as easy as they think.
"Bah. You are well protected, it's true. You have my respect. In that case, I'll offer you my friends-only discount. Or would you prefer to do this the hard way?"
The pirate collects his toll from you, with a slight frown. "Move along, Renegade. We have upgrades to perform."

choice.text: We don't even have 60~. Could we make some other deal?

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_TRACKING
event.text: The highwayman fires his tracking flares, disabling your cloaking system for 20 seconds.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: You've been affected by tracking flares!

event.name: STARGROVE_EXIT_RENEGOTIATE
event.text: "How unfortunate! Lucky for you, I am a reasonable pirate. I will accept the following instead of scrap: 10 of every resource or two of your crew"
You send two of your crew members over to the pirates, condemning them to a life within the Stargrove. Perhaps it will be a mercifully short one.

removeCrew.text: Your crew are not dead, though it's tough to say how long they'll be alive.
Your crew are not dead, though it's tough say how long they'll be alive.

choice.text: You do not have two crew members to offer.

event.text: The pirate collects his toll from you, with a slight frown. "Move along, Renegade."

event.name: ENEMY_AUGMENT_EXPIRES
event.text: Your systems finally manage to overcome the enemy's assault! It will be a fair fight from here!

event.name: ENEMY_AUGMENT_EXPIRES_REACTOR
event.text: Your systems finally manage to overcome the enemy's assault! It will be a fair fight from here!

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_ITEMS_TWIN_PULSARS
event.text: Your ship arrives near a pair of twin pulsars. Stuck at a Lagrange point in between these two stellar objects is the wreckage of an ancient, ruptured Crystal battleship. The pulses of the two pulsars crash against each other, which may prove particularly hazardous to the integrity of your ship.

choice.text: (Upgraded Piloting) Have your ship navigate through the destructive interference.

event.text: As it turns out, your ship is capable of avoiding the majority of the danger by following the patterns of the waves closely. It's tricky to harvest the ship while you're moving along with the destructive interference, but you're able to salvage substantial scrap, as well as an elite Crystal weapon!

choice.text: (Ion Resist) Rely on your ion protection to carry you through.

event.text: It's a bumpy ride, but your ship's defenses against ion damage manage to endure the brunt of the hazardous approach. You're able to salvage substantial scrap, as well as an elite Crystal weapon!

Your ship is buffeted from wave after wave of ionic interference, fluctuating wildly in intensity. The combined forces seem to reverberate through your hull, causing severe damage. Fortunately, the wreckage bears substantial scrap, as well as an elite Crystal weapon!

choice.text: Avoid the twin pulsars as much as possible.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_ITEMS_SUN_JUNK
event.text: A massive debris field closely orbits a nearby star. It contains both natural rock formations and refined metal, suggesting that a structure may have collided with a large asteroid. A gas giant orbits the same star farther away.

choice.text: (Defense Drone) Let your defense drone protect you as you harvest the wreckage [-1|].

event.text: You approach carefully, letting your defense drone pick off any asteroids that get close to you. While there are no identifying markings on the wreckage, the metals within the field seem to be of human origin. Determining anything else about the faction is impossible, but the scrap is yours for the taking.

choice.text: (Rock Plating) Let your armor protect you as you harvest the wreckage.

event.text: As you draw closer to the wreck, the debris pelts your ship. You rely on your armor to protect you. While there are no identifying markings on the wreckage, the metals within the field seem to be of human origin. Determining anything else about the faction is impossible, but the scrap is yours for the taking.

You brave the dangers of the sun and debris field. Doing so leaves you open to bombardment from both sources. While there are no identifying markings on the wreckage, the metals within the field resemble that of human design. Determining anything else about the faction is impossible, but the scrap is yours for the taking.

choice.text: Avoid the asteroid field. Seek shelter behind the gas giant.

event.text: The gas giant gives you enough protection to do something aboard your ship.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_PULSAR_RUIN

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of a ruin.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: In low orbit of the pulsar here, there appear to be a series of large cubical structures surrounded by a thick asteroid field. You may be able to salvage the structures, but the pulsar will make you extremely vulnerable.

event.name: STARGROVE_RUINS_ASTEROID_ENTER
event.text: As you approach, you notice a small ship amongst the ruins. Its power emissions are minimal, but it's clearly still active.
As you near the structure, the ship flares to life and begins charging weapons! You'll have to deal with it before you can explore further.

Attempting to navigate an asteroid field in orbit of a pulsar is dangerous enough, and you're certain that provoking another ship on top of it will end badly. Hopefully you'll be able to jump before the hazards can wreak too much havoc.

destroyed.text: You've managed to destroy the ship. With the threat neutralized, you're able to find a functional weapon in the ruins!

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_FREE_SCRAP
event.text: As you arrive, you spot nothing but stars as far as the eye can see. You are able to track down a destroyed Auto-ship, which carries nothing except the charred remains of its weight in scrap and missiles. However, it is surrounded by live munitions which may go off if you get too close.
The munitions don't pose a threat as you use your arm to grab the wreckage.
The munitions don't pose a threat as you use your arm to grab the wreckage.
You're unable to avoid the explosives as you arrive to harvest the ship. Given the behavior of the munitions, it may have been a rebel trap. Even so, there is enough scrap to harvest.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_THEOCRACY_RECOVERY
event.text: Deep within the nebula, a Theocracy vessel is combing through the clouds, as if searching for something. They do not react to your arrival. They must be preoccupied with their mission.
An annoyed Rockman returns your hail. "We do not have time for your treachery, Federation. We must find our lost comrades before their ship is destroyed."

choice.text: You have no sensors with which to help them.
(Normal Sensors) Offer to use your sensors to help their search.

event.text: Your sensors are completely useless in this situation. Your ineffectual approach only serves to insult the Rockmen. They turn to fight!

choice.text: (Upgraded Sensors) Offer to use your sensors to help their search.

event.text: Your sensors are able to cut the amount of work down. It takes a moderate amount of time, but you eventually lead the Rockmen to their lost crew. "Renegade, you were not... unhelpful. We are willing to share with you our reserves." They send you your reward.

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Offer to use your sensors to help their search.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Offer to use your scanner to help their search.
Respond to their suspicion with violence.

event.text: The Rocks retaliate in kind. "So be it. If they die, then that is more deaths at the behest of your Federation!"
The Rocks do not hesitate to defend themselves. "Foolish Federation! Here, we have the advantage!"

choice.text: Avoid the rock ship and focus on surviving.

surrender.text: "Enough! We only want to succeed in our mission. Leave us be and we will respond in kind."

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Continue looking for their lost ship.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Continue looking for their lost ship.
(Adv. Sensors) Continue looking for their lost ship.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Continue looking for their lost ship.

event.name: STARGROVE_THEOCRACY_HELP
event.text: Your ship is able to track the lost ship down in mere seconds. The Rocks look astonished. "We were quick to judge. They are safe now because of you. Take this, and go in peace, Renegade."

event.name: STARGROVE_THEOCRACY_SCAVENGE
event.text: After a short search, you're able to find the lost and disabled Rock ship. They're barely alive and unwilling to talk. Fortunately, their ship is utterly defenseless to yours, allowing you to make off with whatever remains of their scrap.

event.name: NEBULA_STARGROVE_LOSTREBEL
event.text: Only a proximity alert stops you from crashing into a Rebel vessel at this beacon; the moment you spot them, they silently begin charging their FTL drive.

"Oh, damn it. Look, we surrender. I signed on for a few years of fighting the Federation, and now we're over a decade into fighting every species that can hold a stick, in every universe we can find. We don't have to fight out here - what if we both pretend we never saw each other?"
The Rebel ship delivers their surrender, and silently drifts off into the storm.

"Because our superiors have no interest in looking for one missing ship in the middle of nowhere. This place might be hell, but at least it doesn't hate us personally, and I never have to see another Rebel in my life."

choice.text: Warn them about the coming fleet.

event.text: As you explain your situation, the little joy to be found in the deserter's face fades. "Damn it, I should have known nowhere would be safe eventually. Here, a little thanks - hopefully with a lighter load, we can outrun them."

"Leaving so soon? Shame, not a lot of new people to talk to in these parts. Here - a little fuel to help you along. We'll be staying here a good long while, so feel free to stop by, once this whole war is finished."
Out here, whether or not they've deserted doesn't matter. The scrap from their ship is a valuable commodity, and you're taking it.
These Rebels signed on to fight the Federation, and they're about to get what they asked for. Their captain hangs up the call when he sees you charging weapons, and responds in kind.
You begin charging weapons, and the Rebel responds in kind. Hopefully you can finish this quickly - their engines are still charging!
There are no further incidents as the Rebel vessel finishes its jump prep and vanishes. Now's your turn to leave.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_CRUSADER_MADROCK
event.text: You arrive at a largely abandoned beacon, with only a large star and a powerful Inquisition ship nearby. They seem too occupied with something to care about your arrival.

The Crusaders respond to your hail. "We were sent here on the orders of Stonewall himself to apprehend the traitorous criminal, who nowadays goes by the alias "The Madrock". He was once as honorable and noble as any follower of the Elders, but one day he betrayed us and our sacred teachings, before leaving to reside in this wasteland. Though our allies in the Ministry typically advise us to stay away from here, owing to the severity of Madrock's misdoings, they have permitted us to search for him and offered assistance in this task. Now, leave us be, unless you can help us find him."
Shortly after they cut comms, you receive a hail from a tiny shuttle in the distance, dangerously close to the star. "You there. I get the feeling you're not on the best terms with the Theocracy. A Federation Renegade, if I had to take a wild guess. The Theocracy wants me dead, and they've gone to drastic ends to take me out. But if you can take out those guys, I should be able to make it worth your while. Agreed?"

You're not exactly sure if you want to be taking orders from a supposed Rock criminal, but they are absolutely right about one thing: the Rock Elders are no friends of the Federation. You prepare to fight the Crusaders off, and they respond to your aggression by returning fire.

choice.text: Tell the Crusaders about the message you got.

event.text: You spare no details in your explanation, as you tell the Inquisition ship about the message you got, where it came from, and even what the sender wanted you to do. They thank you and offer you a part of the bounty they received, before setting off to capture the now helpless Madrock.
Individually, solar flares and Crusaders are both dangers you'd rather avoid. Tackling both of them at the same time is just asking for trouble. You make sure to set off again as soon as possible.

escape.text: The Rockmen prepare to jump away. It seems that they value self-preservation over accomplishing their original mission.

gotaway.text: The Crusaders jump away, leaving you alone with Madrock's shuttle.

destroyed.text: The defeat of an Inquisition ship is nothing to scoff at, especially under such hazardous conditions. You scrap their ship before attending to Madrock's shuttle.

deadCrew.text: The defeat of an Inquisition ship is nothing to scoff at, especially under such hazardous conditions. You scrap their ship before attending to Madrock's shuttle.

event.text: Fortunately, Madrock's shuttle appears to still be in fairly good condition. You swoop in and retrieve him before jumping away. Madrock seems content to let you salvage his shuttle for what little it's worth.

You initially can't find Madrock's shuttle, but soon spot it plunging towards the nearby star. Seems its engines must have been struck by a particularly nasty solar flare during your earlier fight. You should still be able to swoop in and save him, but it may be risky.

You send your ship at full speed towards Madrock's shuttle. You're able to retrieve it just in time, but you're forced to take the full brunt of a solar flare just as you're leaving, leaving your ship in considerable disarray. The shuttle should make for good salvage later.

choice.text: (Adv. Shields) Your shields should be able to protect you from the solar flares... mostly.

event.text: You send your ship at full speed towards Madrock's shuttle. Though you manage to retrieve it in time, your ship is hit by a solar flare just as you're preparing to leave. Though your shields absorbed some of the impact, the it still leaves its mark on your ship. Once Madrock is aboard, you scrap his shuttle.

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Quickly move in and save him.

event.text: Your powerful engines let you effortlessly swoop in towards the star, retrieve Madrock's shuttle, and get away before the next solar flare hits your ship. Once Madrock is aboard, you scrap his shuttle.
The nebula makes it difficult to get a lock on his life readings, but you manage to lock your teleporter onto him and safely retrieve him before it's too late.

choice.text: Leave him to his fate, it's too risky to save him.

event.name: CRUSADER_MADROCK_RECRUIT
event.text: Though you initially expected Madrock to be a dangerous Outcast or Commando, at least going off of the description of him given by the Crusaders, you are surprised to find that he's a Crusader. Or at least he once was one. "Phew, thanks for the help there. I'd normally have stuck to a safer spot, but after I learned the Theocracy was hunting me down even here, I knew I wasn't going to avoid them without taking a few risks."

choice.text: So what were they hunting you down for?

event.text: "Hah! I've wanted to tell this to somebody else for ages. So not too long ago, Stonewall himself was inspecting me and a bunch of other Crusaders who weren't on active duty. Just when he reached me and was prepared to hand out some discipline, I kicked him down under, right where it hurts! Ahahaha, you should've seen the look in his eyes! Well, I wasn't able to stick around long enough to appreciate it, but it was all worth it for that. Anyways, since you saved me, and since you also look like somebody who wants to kick Stonewall and his pretentious lot down a peg or two, I think I'll stick with your crew for a good while longer."

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_LOSTSUN
event.text: You're greeted with the sight of a lone Lost Sun ship basking in the glow of the sun. The captain cackles with delight. "Hahaha! This place is wonderous! You can hardly swing a stick around here without hitting a massive celestial ball of fire!" He looks right at the screen and gestures towards you. "Renegade, in the past you may have been challenged by my people to survive near a star. Here, we can truly put your bravery to the test. What say you?"

Ariadne brings her hand down on a nearby bulkhead. "How exactly are you furthering our cause gallavanting around in the wastelands?! You have 10 seconds to justify your mission before I strip you of your rank."
"A-admiral? We were simply trying to keep an eye on the Theocracy's activity in this sector! We'll send you a status report on their movements immediately. But while we were here, we've also been investigating those crazed Zoltan Monks. They have weapons technology beyond anything we've seen. You must get your hands on it, if you can!"
The Lost Suns assauge their Admiral's suspicions with a report, some scrap, a few repairs, and a weapon.

Your Commando informs the Lost Sun vessel about your mission and requests aid. "Ah, I can understand how a comrade of ours would make their way here aboard a Renegade ship. May your fires burn the Rebellion and the Theocracy to cinders!"
Your violent ally cracks whatever passes for knuckles in rock biology. "Take heed, Renegade! We will not go lightly. Do what you can to survive until we are satisfied with your strength!"

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Survive until the Lost Sun are satisfied, but don't destroy them!

event.text: No need to trifle with a challenge. You activate weapons and prepare to fire. "To the death, then. You've made a mistake, Renegade!"
"So you would brave the fires of the Stargrove, but back down from a challenge...? I take it you tested your mettle and found your limits. Go crawl back to the veil of safety."

event.name: STARGROVE_LOSTSUN_VICTORY
event.text: "We are satisfied with your endurance, Renegade. To brave the azure flames with a stoic expression, even as your body is wracked with debilitating pain - you have our respect."

Your Outcast says that they have been captivated by the stars in this sector, and wishes to join the Lost Suns. The captain laughs. "A convert wishes to join our ranks? You have performed admirably, how can we possibly turn you down?"

event.name: STARGROVE_LOSTSUN_ESCAPE
event.text: Once the Lost Suns deliver your reward, they depart. Clearly, they don't intend to be destroyed by the star.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_ENGI_SEPARATIST
event.text: A Separatist circles a massive structure that seems to be collecting resources from the pulsar in this sector. They send you a message. "Renegade, hear [my] -bargain- request. We [need] drones to search for ~}||}|~ data. Our fuel collection -facility- is [highly] efficient. Trade?"

choice.text: Our communications must have glitched. What kind of data were you looking for?

event.text: "??? Translation data -insufficient-. Closest [analog]: Pre-origin? We are sorry. This is all we can say."
The Separatist disconnects and does not bother you further.
The Separatist disconnects and does not bother you further.

event.name: STARGROVE_SEPARATIST_COLLECTOR_ATTACK
event.text: The Separatist immediately disengages communication and moves to protect the resource collector.

event.name: STARGROVE_SEPARATIST_FUEL
event.text: "This ratio is a -steal-. Our collection [processes] are that efficient!"
"Adequate trade. Be on -your- way."
"Appreciated. Be on -your- way."
"Very agreeable. Be on -your- way."
"Combat unfavorable. Accept this -offer- and leave."
"Combat unfavorable. Accept this -offer- and leave."

event.name: STARGROVE_SEPARATIST_THREATEN_EXPLOSION
event.text: As soon as you accept the fuel onto your ship, it explodes in a massive fireball! The Separatist move to engage.

event.name: STARGROVE_FUEL_COLLECTOR_SALVAGE
event.text: The Separatist structure is quite strong. It doesn't look like it will be easy to salvage this while your ship is being bombarded by the pulsar.
You are able to process the materials in the collector to obtain a modest yield.
The yield is surprisingly unimpressive.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_ASTEROID
event.text: A nearby pulsar has a ring of asteroids. One of the them is rich in heavy-metal content, the light of the pulsar reflecting off it enticingly. However, this is also the densest section of the ring. It may be dangerous, and maneuverability would be low.

You find an area on the asteroid and begin to mine it. However, after you land and start to extract its resources, your ship's alarms go off - another asteroid suddenly changed course and threatens to smash into your ship!

The incoming asteroid poses little danger to your ship because of its armor plating. You maneuver to crash through in the safest way possible. It looks as though it was equipped with a magnetic device that attracted it to your position; it was a trap. Without any further danger, you continue to harvest.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: The asteroid is expected to strike within this amount of time. Make sure to destroy it or run before the timer reaches 0!

event.name: STARGROVE_ASTEROID_DESTROYED
event.text: You reduce the asteroid to debris small enough that it poses no further threat to your ship. It looks as though it was equipped with a magnetic device that attracted it to your position; it was a trap. Without any further danger, you continue to harvest.

event.name: STARGROVE_ASTEROID_COLLIDE
event.text: You're unable to avoid the asteroid within the dense debris field. It careens into your ship causing massive damage. It looks as though it was equipped with a magnetic device that attracted it to your position; it was a trap. You're still able to scrounge a few more materials before departing.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_LANIUS_GHOST_STUCK
event.text: Indeterminate wreckage is a common sight in the Stargrove. A badly wrecked, barely functional ship that has smashed into a small Lanius ship broadcasts a basic distress call amidst a large field of debris. Entering the debris may be risky.
As you get closer, you detect multiple transporter signals as they are blocked by your Energy Shield, as well as Lanius and Ghost lifesigns within the wrecks.
"Thank. Needed metal to live. Was attacked immediately. Unfriendly Phantoms. Recommend avoiding." Taking heed of the Welder's words, you opt to scrap the ships and move on.

choice.text: With no teleporter, you cannot save any of the aliens.

event.text: Whoever is on board those ships are trying to board without permission. You decide not to entertain them and resort to scrapping their ships while they are alive.
You decide to abandon the ships. The debris field is enough trouble without trying to get involved with suspicious teleporter signals.
You ignore the debris and focus on making it to the next beacon.

event.name: STARGROVE_LANIUS_GHOST_TELEPORT
event.text: The inhabitants of the ships are able to materialize onto your ship! One Lanius Welder and several Ghosts appear. It's clear there is a tense stand-off between the two of them, which will escalate into hostilities.
You stand with the Lanius. The moment you point your weapons at the Ghosts, a fight breaks out!
You aim your weapons at the Lanius. The moment that you do, it goes berserk. A fight breaks out! The Ghosts head for cover rather than help you.

event.name: STARGROVE_LANIUS_GHOST_LANIUS_WIN
event.text: "Thank. Needed metal to live. Ghosts attacked immediately. Will help." With everyone from the wreck dealt with, you scrap the ships and prepare to jump.

event.name: STARGROVE_LANIUS_GHOST_GHOST_WIN
event.text: "Relief at last! That voracious metal fiend troubles us no more!" The Ghosts offer you a weapon in exchange for passage out of the area. Before you leave, you are able to scrap the ships.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_OBELISK_RUIN_CRYSTAL
event.text: The massive blue star sends your sensors haywire. There is a strange, cubical green structure orbiting the star. You receive a Crystal distress signal from within. "Whoever you are, please get us out of here! We came here to study our ancient history. We hid here to remain protected from that star, but now we're trapped within this horrid structure!"

choice.text: (Anointed) Interface with the structure to instruct it to open.

event.text: "Have run into this before. You send exit command, like this!" The Anointed quickly taps some commands on your console and sends it to the structure. The structure's door begins to open...

Your translator is able to request a list of commands that the structure will respond to. One of the commands will let you open the structure and set the crystals free. The structure's door begins to open...

choice.text: (Obelisk Crew) Translate the words on the ruins.

event.text: The Obelisk is easily able to send a command to the structure. The structure's door begins to open...

choice.text: (Cognitive Crew) Command the structure to open.

event.text: Telling the structure to open is trivial for the Cognitive. It sends the remote command without hesitation. The structure's door begins to open...

choice.text: (Adv. Hacking) Force the structure to open.

event.text: Your hacking system quickly decrypts the possible commands and spoofs a request that makes the structure open.
Your hacking system can brute force the door opening routine, but it will take some time. You'll have to survive while it works!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Your hacking will take some time!

choice.text: (Hack Weapon) Attempt to open the structure.

event.text: Your hacking weapon can brute force the door opening routine, but it will take some time. You'll have to survive while it works!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Your hacking will take some time!

choice.text: (Powerful Beam) Attempt to cut a hole in the structure.

event.text: You're able to pierce through the tough metal, but it will take a few seconds to finish slicing the structure open.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Cutting through the ship will take some time!

choice.text: (Damaging Beam Weapon) Attempt to cut a hole in the structure.

event.text: Your weapon is capable of burning through the metal, but its arduous work, given how tough the structure's metal is. You're going to be here for a while!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Cutting through the ship will take some time!

choice.text: (Teleporter) Offer to beam the Crystals out.

event.text: "Oh no... we'll have to leave so much stuff behind! Well, it's better than dying, I guess." The Crystals accept being transported onto your ship, but don't seem happy about it. "Would you be willing to buy some of the stuff we managed to take with us? That's all we can offer, I'm afraid."
"We'll go mad if you leave us here! You have to save us!" You mute communications and prepare to jump.

event.name: STARGROVE_RUINS_OPEN
event.text: The Crystal ship immediately emerges from within the structure. The Crystals seem relieved at their rescue. "We were going to go crazy in there. By the way, we found a highly unusual piece of technology in that structure - we'll let you have it. Meanwhile, would you like to purchase something from us?"

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_ENGI_DEFENDER
event.text: A Defender ship seems to be glitching out. "Connection issue! Errors found. Severance imminent." Judging by the trail of debris, this ship may have been in orbit for quite some time.

choice.text: (Turzil) Attempt to liberate this ship from the Harmony.

event.text: "TRZ-1L? TRZ-1L? -TRZ-1L-?" It looks like it's starting to work, but you may have to soften them up first.

choice.text: (Separatist) Attempt to liberate this ship from the Harmony.

event.text: "Priority target? Priority target? -Priority target-?" It looks like it's starting to work, but you may have to soften them up first.

choice.text: Attack them while their communications are down.

event.text: "Renegade = aggressor! Error, contact failing" They attack you, their combat strength still seems to be at full potential!

Your Engi interfaces with the Defender ship. They explain that the it must have been worn down by the harsh conditions of the sector, and the nanomachines have gone haywire. However, your own Engi is able to update the ship with its own nano-patterns.
As the ship begins to right itself, you receive a message. "Defender == grateful. Stargrove mission parameters have been lost. Recovering... Historical information acquisition? Unsure. Returning to Harmony."
The ship also graces you with a reward.

choice.text: Escape from the Pulsar and leave the Engi behind.

event.text: You decide to focus on leaving behind the pulsar. The Engi ship continues to glitch out, seemingly unable to escape its orbit.

event.name: SURRENDER_ENGI_PULSAR_OVERRIDE
event.text: The ship is weakened. The Engi crew are confused and frantic. They seem to be surrendering.

The Engi onboard calm down. "Memories of Harmony not found. Directives corrupted. TRZ-1L, please clarify what has happened."
"Call me Turzil. You are no -longer- connected to the Harmony. The faulty -connection- that the pulsar caused was interfering with [your] processing, soft-locking your mobility."
"Harmony directives = corrupted. Memories == hazy. "
"You [may] live as you please. We -reccomend- you leave this sector."
"Understood. Will think things through."
The Engi ship is now able to leave the orbit of the pulsar. Before they leave, they give a reward for their freedom, and one of the Engi offers to join.

The Engi onboard calm down. "Memories of Harmony not found. Directives corrupted. Renegade, please clarify what has happened."
Your Separatist explains to them that they are free to self determinate, and recommends a nearby Separatist sector. The newly liberated Engi thank you for your part in rescuing them from the pulsar.

choice.text: Accept their surrender and leave them to their fate.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_FEDTRACKER
event.text: Federation probes are a rare sight, intended for use in maintenance and long-term exploration operations where resupply isn't an option. It transmits a coded signal shortly after your arrival, and after a few minutes of deciphering, you have it translated: "IFF signature recognized. (1) message available with current clearance. Transmit current Earth year to accept."

You send your reply, and shortly recieve another coded message. "Primary mission objective: shadow a Coalition vessel detected on a course for the Stargrove. Original plan: mark vessel location and return to base for assistance. Insufficient fuel remaining, defaulting to plan B: wait for any Federation vessel, then transmit location data. This ship is authorized to offer sector maps and repairs upon mission completion."
"Reply signal verified - transmitting last known location of Coalition vessel."
Whatever the message is, it can't be as important as your mission. You tune out the signal and prepare to make your exit.
If this probe can't make it home, you'll just have to make use of it yourself. You begin charging weapons, and the its engines roar to life. You'll have to try and destroy it fast!

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_QUEST_STARGROVE_TRACKER

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Federation auto-probe has tracked a Coalition vessel to this beacon.

event.text: The intensity of the sunlight bouncing off of the Coalition ship you were tracking blinds you when you first arrive. When you at last manage to force your eyes open, you realize they've already turned to face you - if you were hoping for the element of surprise here, you've clearly lost it.

"Ah, the Fedsss sssent a Renegade to meet ussss. Doessss that mean you already learned about our planssss from another universssse, or did you jussst get lucky again? Bleh, it doessssn't matter. Every chance we get to make new alliessss, you Fedsss wind up beating ussss to the punch. That changesss here. The Infernum WILL join the Coalition. And if they don't want to, that'sss fine, we mosssstly want them for sssuicide bombersss anyway. Now, will you leave ussss to our missssion, or do we have to throw your broken wreck of a sssship into the nearesssst gravity well?"
The Coalition doesn't need any more allies, and it certainly doesn't need an army of disposable soldiers. You give the order to charge weapons, and prepare to fight.
By the time there's any consequences to this, you'll probably have already left this universe. Surviving to destroy the Flagship is far more important than a hypothetical future enemy to worry about.

event.name: COALITION_QUEST_STARGROVE_DESTROYED
event.text: You move to look for any respite from the star, and manage to find a small safe spot before the probe returns. When it does arrive, it silently transmits its sector data and repairs your ship, then begins moving directly towards the nearest sun. You'd heard rumors that auto-probes had directives to do anything to avoid capture, but never had the opportunity to see the behavior in action - you make a mental note to brag about this once you've completed your mission, then prepare to jump.

escape.text: The probe doesn't have enough fuel to get home, but it's still focused on self-preservation - it's trying to escape.

destroyed.text: A ship this size isn't worth much, but it's more than you'd get by leaving it alone.
You've put a stop to the Coalition's plans in this sector - for now. Satisfied, you scrap the ship and prepare for the auto-probe's arrival.

deadCrew.text: The disparate races of the Coalition, once divided, have now congealed into one massive mess on the inside of the destroyer. Satisfied, you begin scrapping the ship while you wait for the auto-probe to catch up.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_FEDERATION_STARGROVE
textList.text: A highly advanced Federation stealth ship emerges from the murky depths of the nebula. "Renegades. Everything was ruined once you started showing up. But out here... we can finally bring justice without the red tape holding us back." The crazed Federation captain terminates the call and attacks!
A Federation message arrives at your command console. "You've disturbed my retirement. I'll make short work of you too." A stealth ship decloaks behind you!
A Federation stealth ship approaches on an attack vector from beyond the star. "You made a mistake coming to the Stargrove, Renegade. I need supplies, and no one will ever know what happened here."
The moment you arrive, you are immediately ambushed by a Federation stealth ship that refuses your hails. You'll have to fight your way out.

event.name: DEFEAT_FED_ELITE_STARGROVE
event.text: The rogue Federation stealth ship that attacked you has been eliminated. It's not clear what brought them here or what their story was, but it's unlikely that anyone else will ever hear what either of you did here.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Federation ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

choice.text: (Anti-Virus) Counter their attempt to jam your systems.
(Anti-Virus) Counter their attempt to jam your systems.
(Anti-Virus) Counter their attempt to jam your systems.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_STARGROVE
textList.text: A pirate cuts you off. The moment you notice them, your computer start to register foreign interference. "You fool! I, Two-Eyed Kern shall render you utterly helpless before I plunder your goods! My vision is unparalleled!"

A sinister laugh comes from your comm as your ship starts malfunctioning. "You're pretty far from home, Fed. You and your crew are about to learn up close and personal why I'm not allowed in Federation space anymore."

A battle-hardened pirate accosts your ship. "Look at you, flying through the Stargrove like you own the place. I wonder how much scrap you have in your hold? Well, I'm not going to wait long to find out." Your ship's computer detects something interfering with its systems!
A devious-looking creature starts to jam your ship's systems. "We caught a Renegade, boys. Let's strip it down, and see if it's got one of those rare weapons they leave lying around!"

event.name: STARGROVE_ANTI_VIRUS_PIRATE
event.text: You successfully purge their harmful interference from your systems. It's a fair fight from here!
Your reactor starts to sputter out. Looks like they managed to significantly weaken your power output!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: You've been affected by an EMP!

event.text: Your piloting system goes haywire! Evading will be hard, if not impossible like this!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: You've been affected by a piloting hacker!

event.text: Your engines are glitching out! You might find it difficult to escape with this level of interference.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: You've been affected by an engine jammer!

event.text: Your shields are glitching out! You're going to have a harder time enduring their attacks.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: You've been affected by shield jamming!
You've been affected by a weapon jammer!

event.text: Some of your weapons aren't working right. This fight may prove a challenge!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: You've been affected by tracking flares!

event.text: Your cloaking device isn't responding properly. You might have to take a few hits.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_LISTENING_POST_QUEST
event.text: Orbiting the pulsar, a damaged Federation station desperately calls for help. Its communication array is particularly sophisticated - it seems to utilize the waves of the pulsar itself as a sector-wide radar. A Duskbringer vessel is holding its position near the station until you arrive. "Stay out of this, Renegade. Our pilgrimage is almost complete. The promised land beckons... So do not interfere!"
"So be it!" The Duskbringer attacker proclaims. "You will be our final trial by combat before we achieve true enlightenment!"

choice.text: (Duskbringer Crew) "You're not the only ones who seek the promised lands."

event.text:
Your Duskbringer explains that you are already seeking to enter the promised lands, and that if they leave the station alone, that you will take them to where they want to go.
"We've been interrogating these fools for information for days now. If you can get us what we need, we will spare them."
You exercise caution. Unfortunately, you cannot get close enough to gain enough protection from the pulsar that would allow you to do something aboard the ship.

destroyed.text: As the ship crumbles around them, the captain screams out his final lament. "It can't be! The promised land was in our grasp!" Their ship finally explodes, allowing you to collect its remains.

deadCrew.text: The clonebay sputters out and refuses to produce anymore Duskbringer clones. Their path to enlightenment has failed, and their ship is yours to plunder.

event.name: STARGROVE_LISTENING_POST_SAVED
event.text: "Are they finally gone?" A tired and injured crew-member of the listening post says. "The damage we sustained hampered our ability to broadcast over a long range. We had to use a standard distress frequency... thank goodness you happened to be passing through. Our duty is to keep track of all sanctioned Federation activity within the sector so that an organized search and rescue can be performed. One of the astrophysicists within this sector, Mafan has been cornered by some crazed Zoltan monks while researching the Gravastar."

"The Gravastar is the focal point of this sector's strange properties. It's been traveling through this nebula for eons, condensing the gasses into stars and leaving massive destruction in its wake. The potential advances we could gain through studying it are extraordinary. If you're willing to brave the dangers of this landmark to rescue that scientist, we'll send you the coordinates."
"As you wish. Be careful. From the sound of Mafan's predicament, their attackers seem particularly dangerous and unusual."
"We understand. We'll work on fixing our communication array, but please let someone know as soon as you can regardless. We have no way of knowing how long Mafan can hold out."

event.name: QUEST_STARGROVE_GRAVASTAR

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A scientist has been cornered by some unusual Zoltan Monks.

event.text: Your ship's readout warns that you have come in close proximity to an incredibly massive object - the Gravastar. The nebula gasses have coalesced into an accretion disk, which may give sensors enough breathing room to function properly. The speed at which the gasses are travelling creates periodic waves of heat. At the same time, your ship's hull begins to buckle under the intense gravity. Spacetime itself warps around you, causing the color spectrum to shift to and fro. Before you even get close to the science vessel you're supposed to save, another ship intercepts you. An orange Zoltan broadcasts a message. "Another foe? How enjoyable. Perhaps this one will engage in bloodthirsty combat instead of cowering in a deep orbit. Well, interloper? Are you prepared to burn?"

"Far be it from me to hide our glorious name from one who is about to die by our hands." The strange monk opens his arms wide. "We are the Infernum. We have attained a level of evolution the likes of which the stagnant Ministry could never even dream!" He laughs joyously. "With each peril, our glory shines brighter. But, the one below wishes to cast open the gates to our wonderful slice of damnation, to invite the unworthy into our domain. Unacceptable! And now that you know, you must die as well!"
"How agreeable you are!" The monk cackles. "Come, let us fight with everything we have!"
"We do not. Allow us to demonstrate." The monk ship immediately attacks!

event.name: QUEST_STARGROVE_GRAVASTAR_MONK_MESSAGE
event.text:
You recount the Monk's parable.
"Did you really think your insipid tale would move our hearts? We have abandoned the false wisdom of nonviolence - as your ship burns, the folly of your beliefs shall be self-evident!"
However, despite this, one of the crew seems to have taken your words to heart and takes a fighting posture against the others! The transmission cuts and they charge weapons.

event.name: STARGROVE_CONTACT_MAFAN_REAL
event.text: You send a message to the science vessel. All you get back is an undecipherable message: "#::..::/" After a slight adjustment, the signal clears up. "Testing?? Ah, got it working again. Hello, welcome to the Stargrove's mighty Gravastar! Few ever get to see a splendid celestial body like this one up close, hm? Oops, I am getting ahead of myself, as usual. I may need your help to escape my current predicament. The only way I could escape the wrath of those megalomaniacs was to occupy this particular point within the gravity well. But as a consequence... this ship is in no shape to move. Any thoughts?"

choice.text: Risk your ship by flying close enough to scrap the ship and save its sole crew.

event.text: Your ship's weak engines fight the extreme gravitation. Your ship falters quite significantly as you dive into the star. Time scales more and more, and your ship starts to buckle under the strain of extreme gravity. As a consolation prize, not only do you save Mafan, but you have the opportunity to scrap the ship before you return from within the gravity well. Unfortunately, the time dilation has allowed the fleet to advance considerably.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Risk your ship by flying close enough to scrap the ship and save its sole crew.

event.text: Your ship's modest engines fight the extreme gravitation with some success. Time scales more and more, and your ship starts to buckle under the strain of extreme gravity. As a consolation prize, not only do you save Mafan, but you have the opportunity to scrap the ship before you return from within the gravity well. Unfortunately, the time dilation has allowed the fleet to advance.

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Risk your ship by flying close enough to scrap the ship and save its sole crew.

event.text: Your ship's powerful engines fight the extreme gravitation as it inches closer. Time scales more and more, but your ship can handle it without much damage. As a bonus, not only do you save Mafan, but you have the opportunity to scrap the ship before you return from within the gravity well. Unfortunately, the time dilation has allowed the fleet to advance, but not by much.

choice.text: (Temporal Manipulator) Counteract the gravitational time dilation long enough to free Mafan's ship.

event.text: Mafan's vessel is able to break free from the Gravastar. The ship is clearly on its last legs as it putters slowly towards you. Your crew scuttle it as Mafan boards.

choice.text: (Aether Drive) Jump directly to Mafan's ship.

event.text: You jump directly in front of Mafan's ship, knowing your drive will also pilot you safely away. Not only do you save Mafan, but you have the opportunity to scrap the ship before you return from within the gravity well.

choice.text: (Aether Drive) Jump directly to Mafan's ship.

event.text: You jump directly in front of Mafan's ship, knowing your drive will also pilot you safely away. Not only do you save Mafan, but you have the opportunity to scrap the ship before you return from within the gravity well.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Teleport Mafan to your own ship.

event.text: You're able to lock on to and beam Mafan directly into your teleporter room. The ship remains in orbit, and will likely remain there until it decays and crashes into its surface.

choice.text: You'll have to wait for somebody else. We can't help.

event.text: "Well, that sucks." Mafan mutters. "I can only hope the listening post can find somebody else before too long."

event.name: STARGROVE_INVITE_MAFAN
event.text: Mafan arrives on your ship holding all of their research and breathes a sigh of relief. "I have to say, that was starting to feel like a real monkey's paw situation there. Find the opportunity of my dreams and then immediately become doomed to only do that for the rest of my life?" Mafan shudders. "At any rate, I have a number of things I'd be happy to share with you - not only am I skilled in manning a ship's systems, but I have some information about a possible expedition we could go on."

"That's right. In my studies, I have determined where the Infernum have decided to reside, as well as the optimal path to go there. If you're interested, we could travel to their space and see what other novel things we can learn!"
"...or at least, that's what I would say, if we were ready. For now, you will have to wait for me to give my update on the Infernum to my superiors. Wait for an 'Infernal Update' so to speak." Mafan says, with a wink.

event.name: STARGROVE_CLEARING_MONK
event.text: You've managed to reach a safe location, and much to your surprise, you're hailed by a Monk vessel. "Greetings, Federation Renegade. Our ship has been sent here to serve as a guide for the wayward souls who find themselves in the Stargrove. Do you have a moment to listen?"

The Monk recounts a brief parable in which the protagonist and her brother are forced to pass through a burning building. The fortitude of the protagonist's soul keeps the flames at bay, but her brother gives into fear and is burned badly. He is consumed by anger, and blames the protagonist for his scars. He pulls a piece of burning wood from the wreckage and plunges it into his sister's heart, only to feel the pain in his own chest as he destroys himself.
"Thank you for hearing us. You have a dangerous journey ahead of you, but so long as you do not give in to fear and anger, the fires of these suns cannot touch your soul. Take this, and be well."
You have no time to hear the ramblings of Monks, especially here. You close the channel and prepare to depart.

event.name: STARGROVE_SEPARATIST_STORE
event.text: The stars here are sparse, making this beacon relatively temperate and peaceful. A station full of Separatist Engi reside here. "Welcome to p-p-p-paradise, -outsider-. We have finally f-f-found a [place] to be free of the -dreadful- Harmony. Here, you [are] safe. S-s-s-stay here for as -long- as you want."

choice.text: Your Defender protests this encampment of Separatists.

event.text: Upon seeing your Defender, the Separatists recoil. "Agent of t-t-the Harmony! We -will- not let [you] pass!"
"B-b-by entering the Stargrove, y-y-you must be -recycled-. We can l-l-liberate your crew instead. In, or out?" They train their weapons on you, anticipating a response.

The Separatists relax. "Then, your crew is -saved-! R-r-rejoice!" The Separatists take your crew away, and stuff them into a chamber. When they emerge, they seem different. Afterwards, they show you their shop.
The Separatists immediately become aggressive. "-Incorrect- response."
The Separatists makes no acknowledgement of your existence.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_STARGROVE_SMUGGLER_STORE
event.text: Amidst the raging stars, a mercenary ship is chasing down a smuggler. This may be one of your few opportunities to acquire supplies in such a desperate place.
The mercenary pauses its pursuit and turns to fight you.
The two ships continue their dance through the stars as you prepare to leave.

destroyed.text: The mercenary ship is now in pieces. As you gather its scrap, you receive a message from a grateful smuggler.

deadCrew.text: The mercenary ship is devoid of pirate scum. As you strip it for parts, you receive a message from a grateful smuggler.

event.name: STARGROVE_SMUGGLER_STORE
event.text: "Here's a piece of advice: don't double cross a major member of the Syndicate without an exit strategy. Even after running into this hellhole, they chased after us for days! I have no intention to piss off a Renegade after that debacle, so let's do business, yeah? Be quick about it, we need to stake out a good place to lay low."

event.name: STARGROVE_SAFE_HAVEN
event.text: Your ship's readouts have finally calmed down, there are no hazards or foes here. This could be one of your few opportunities to rest. The research outpost here attempts to contact you on a Federation frequency.

"Welcome, Renegade. The travel restrictions keep the traffic in this sector low, as you might expect. We have a request, if you have the time: Our primary auto cruiser has gone missing. We can't afford to weaken the defenses of the outpost to go looking for it. Do you think you could spare the effort to track it down?"

"It's very dangerous to do research in the Stargrove. Due to the Federation's safety regulations, some of the most novel areas are restricted. Fortunately, our auto cruiser is able to collect data without risking Federation lives. The one that went missing is on a mission to investigate possible signs of exotic life in a remote part of the sector."
This is a rare opportunity to safely do something aboard your ship.

event.name: STARGROVE_SAFE_HAVEN_QUEST_ACCEPT
event.text: "Perfect. Here is the ship's last known location. Find out what's wrong. When you've found it, send it the data packet that we're forwarding to you now." They send you an encrypted file along with the location the ship was last sent to.

choice.text: See what services the outpost has to offer.

event.name: STARGROVE_SAFE_HAVEN_QUEST_REFUSE
event.text: This sector is plenty dangerous as it is. You can't afford to get mixed up in this.

choice.text: See what services the outpost has to offer.

event.name: STARGROVE_SAFE_HAVEN_OFFERS
event.text: There are a number of scientists and technicians who operate here. You can get the defenses on your ship upgraded, ask for repairs or to receive a resource bundle.
The outpost's skilled crew is able to quickly install the requested upgrade.
The outpost's skilled crew is able to quickly install the requested upgrade.
The outpost's skilled crew is able to quickly install the requested upgrade.
The outpost's skilled crew is able to quickly install the requested upgrade.
The outpost's skilled crew is able to quickly patch up your hull.
The outpost loads what resources they're willing to part with onto your ship.

choice.text: Do something onboard the ship instead.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_QUEST_STARGROVE_AUTO_CRUISER

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Federation auto cruiser went missing here.

event.text: Instead of an auto cruiser you immediately notice an advanced Dynasty ship firing its weapons directly at the nearest star. When they notice you, they warn you off. "Stay your approach, foul Renegade! Your dreadful abomination has aligned itself with those contemptible nightmares. Do not interfere."

"Halt." Dessius commands. "This particular ship is not your enemy."
"Dessius? Centuries have passed since this mission was first undertaken. Are we to abandon our quest right at the culmination of our duties?"
"Clearly the threat they posed was vastly overstated. If they come to be the danger we feared them to be, we will have the opportunity to change course." Dessius made a gesture. "Your success in locating them is noted, but you are relieved of this mission."
"...As you wish."
As the enemy ship departs, the Federation auto cruiser emerges from its position near the star.
"The empty ones that should not exist! They cannot exist! They aren't there, yet they lurk!" The Dynasty captain struggles to fit his anguish into words.
You intervene, preventing the Dynasty ship from making any more attacks on the ship you were sent to protect.
You inform them that they don't sound too dissimilar to the way they describe their foes. It does not amuse them.
"How typical. The Federation defends its abomination and its new pets." The Dynasty cruiser turns to attack you instead!
"A wise choice. These horrific creatures need to be dealt with."

destroyed.text: The Dynasty ship crumples under the weight of your assault. As you collect the scrap, the Federation auto cruiser emerges from its position near the star.

deadCrew.text: The Dynasty ship's crew have been discorporated. As you harvest their ship, the Federation auto cruiser emerges from its position near the star.

event.name: STARGROVE_AUTO_CONTACT
event.text: You send the auto cruiser the encrypted file given by the outpost. It responds by transmitting a text report of its mission and a full spreadsheet of the data it has been gathering. Apparently, the ship was successful in locating some exotic life, which it has termed "Vacuities". The auto ship offers an additional reward for rescuing it.

According to the report by the cruiser, a Vacuity is a starborne entity not directly detectable by any known sensor. They are indirectly detectable by the negative space that they create upon the surface of the star. The auto managed to detect an encoding caused by the Vacuities that appears to be a short, improvised distress signal by manipulating the radiation of the star. The auto cruiser translated the message as: "Help. Foe returned. We offer alliance."

choice.text: Instruct the auto cruiser to return to the outpost.
Instruct the auto cruiser to return to the outpost.

event.name: STARGROVE_AUTOSHIP_RETURN
event.text: A prerecorded message plays. "Acknowledged." Then, you receive a text-only communication from the ship offering to install its sensor augmentation on your vessel before it departs.
